answers.answer: That's hard to say. Go here to the American Diabetes web site to see if you are a diabetic http://www.diabetes.org/home.jsp.

Numbness and tingling could be a symptom of many problems.  If you have weight loss, your drinking a lot of water and still thirsty and signs of what feels like a bladder or urinary track infections, these can be signs.  See you doctor for a A1c test.  This blood test show your average blood sugar levels over the last three months.  Wait to worry until your tested.

question: Is having a numb and tingling feeling in your fingers a sympton of diabetes.
title: possible sympton of diabetes
